news.title: Fannie Mae, Freddie Mac to Count Crypto in Mortgage Risk Assessments
news.body: In a groundbreaking move, Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac will now include cryptocurrency assets in their risk evaluations for mortgage loans. Directed by FHFA's William J. Pulte, this policy could broaden mortgage access for crypto investors, potentially transforming the U.S. housing market landscape.

news.title: South Korean Banks Forge Ahead with Won-Backed Stablecoin
news.body: Leading South Korean banks are forming a consortium to launch a stablecoin backed by the South Korean Won. This initiative underscores the growing integration of digital currencies within Asia's mainstream banking systems, setting a precedent for future digital currency acceptance.

news.title: Envestnet Divests Yodlee to Focus on Core Business Strategies
news.body: Envestnet is selling its data analytics arm, Yodlee, to STG, signaling a strategic refocus on its primary financial services. This sale could significantly influence the financial data analytics sector and the future of open banking.

news.title: Mastercard to Open A2A Payments Testing Sandbox in the UK
news.body: Mastercard is set to launch an Account-to-Account (A2A) instant payments sandbox for UK banks. This platform will facilitate the development of innovative payment solutions, potentially speeding up the adoption of instant payments throughout the UK.

news.title: German Financial Regulator BaFin Ramps Up Oversight Post-Wirecard
news.body: Germany's BaFin is taking a tougher regulatory stance following the Wirecard scandal. This shift towards more aggressive oversight aims to prevent future financial frauds, impacting regulatory frameworks and trust in the European financial markets.
